creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
sometimes, the sitetree.js is serialized as html, which breaks the javascript
and you get:

Error: syntax error
Source File: http://127.0.0.1:8888/default/authoring/info-sitetree/tree.js
Line: 1
Source Code:
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

which leads to:

Error: initializeDocument is not defined
Source File:
http://127.0.0.1:8888/default/info-authoring/index_de.html?lenya.usecase=info-overview&lenya.step=showscreen
Line: 161

this hides the sitetree. subsequent clicking on the authoring tab logs you out,
so i assume that the sitetree.js sometimes triggers the login screen. the
probable cause of this bug is the acess control interfering with the serving of
sitetree.js

can someone test this? is it still happening? i suspect problems with the
authorizer inserting itself (login page)
creator: gregor@apache.org

text: no longer relevant; sitetree is now generated differently
creator: gregor@apache.org
